# helpers.williams_transform { #pyLHD.helpers.williams_transform }

`helpers.williams_transform(arr, baseline=1)`

Williams Transformation

## Parameters

| Name       | Type          | Description                                                                              | Default    |
|------------|---------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`      | npt.ArrayLike | A numpy ndarray                                                                          | _required_ |
| `baseline` | int           | A integer, which defines the minimum value for each column of the matrix. Defaults to 1. | `1`        |

## Returns

| Type          | Description                                                                                                                     |
|---------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| npt.ArrayLike | After applying Williams transformation, a matrix whose columns are permutations from {baseline,baseline+1, ..., baseline+(n-1)} |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
random_ls = pyLHD.LatinSquare(size = (5,3))
random_ls
```
Change the baseline
```{python}
pyLHD.williams_transform(random_ls,baseline=3)
```
